title.value: Differential Chromatin Architecture and Risk Variants in Deep Layer Excitatory Neurons and Grey Matter Microglia Contribute to Major Depressive Disorder
title.justification: The title is derived directly from the paper.
title.quote: Differential Chromatin Architecture and Risk Variants in Deep Layer Excitatory Neurons and Grey Matter Microglia Contribute to Major Depressive Disorder

extractions.description: This paper investigates the genome-wide regulatory differences and the effects of disease risk variants in individuals with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) by analyzing chromatin accessibility and single-cell gene-expression profiles in cells from the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex. The study identifies specific cell types and regulatory mechanisms that may contribute to MDD.

type.justification: The study involves empirical research methods, including snATAC-seq and snRNA-seq, to measure and analyze chromatin accessibility and gene expression.
type.quote: Here, we bridge current knowledge gaps by employing single-nucleus assay for transposase-accessible chromatin with sequencing (snATAC-seq), which provides unprecedented opportunities for interrogating epigenetic and genetic variants through the lens of chromatin accessibility...

name.justification: The paper focuses on genome-wide chromatin accessibility and gene expression profiling.
name.quote: Here we investigate genome-wide regulatory differences and putative gene-regulatory effects of disease risk-variants by examining chromatin accessibility combined with single-cell gene-expression profiles...

name.justification: The focus is on genetic and regulatory mechanisms contributing to Major Depressive Disorder.
name.quote: MDD-associated accessibility alterations were prominent in deep-layer excitatory neurons...

name.justification: The dataset is referenced and utilized for comparing chromatin regions with known histone markers.
